subject: Re: Running a test under two different runners.
msgSnippet: ... compound ... don t have ... Behalf Of ... class ... instantiate the particular runner that you want to run the test class under. Actually I am currently
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kent Beck" <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> I can't think of a built in way. However, I think you could write a
compound
> runner that would take a list of runners. Now I'm curious, but I
don't have
> time to program it at the moment.
>
> Good luck,
>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>
> _____
>
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of
> kelvsyc
> Sent: Friday, April 11, 2008 5:23 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Running a test under two different runners.
>
>
>
> Suppose I have a test class, which I want to run with two different
> Runners. How would I do so without having to duplicate the test
class
> (such that each copy has a different RunWith annotation)?
>
>
>
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>I would create an interface for the runners. Then at run-time,
instantiate the particular runner that you want to run the test class
under.
Actually I am currently working on a similar code for test automation.
